project-detail.heading: Project Overview
project-detail.copy: Java Finder is an idea that developed when I was in Vancouver looking for a cafe to work in. When I did come across one and found a comfy quiet corner spot, I was told that they did not offer wifi. This is common with many cafes in the city because they want to maximize and increase turnover. I don't believe I was the only one who encountered this issue. The future of Java Finder is to work with cafes across multiple cities so users are able to find a cafe that meets their needs. Information such available seats and wifi availability are unique to Java Finder. I aim to create a website and app that is simple, easy to use and navigate across all devices.

project-detail.heading: Research
project-detail.copy: In my research, I found similar apps and websites that I was able to draw inspirations and ideas from. I found that the apps and websites designs had at least one supplementary colour that complemented the overall colours of the website. Additionally, the apps and websites were simple and clean, so that was something I wanted to emulate.
